original_title: Sri Lanka rupee weaker, bond yields flat
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed at 301.00/15 to the US dollar in the spot market Tuesday, slightly weaker from 300.97/301.00 a day earlier, while bond yields were flat.
The market awaited news on Trump tariffs, with opinion on the reduced 30 percent rate divided. But fiscal performance was improving.
In the secondary market, a bond maturing 15.12.2026 was closed at 8.05/15 percent, flat from 8.05/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 close at 8.45/55 percent, flat.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 closed at 8.75/85 percent from 8.75/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 closed at 9.48/52 marginally up from 9.48/54 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2033 was closed 10.70/90 percent, stead from 10.70/73 percent. (Colombo/Jul15/2025)
